2 Timothy__02.1: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace which is in Christ Jesus:
2 Timothy__02.2: And the things which thou hast heard of me by many witnesses, the same commend to faithful men, who shall be fit to teach others also.
2 Timothy__02.3: Labour as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
2 Timothy__02.4: No man, being a soldier to God, entangleth himself with secular businesses; that he may please him to whom he hath engaged himself.
2 Timothy__02.5: For he also that striveth for the mastery, is not crowned, except he strive lawfully.
2 Timothy__02.6: The husbandman, that laboureth, must first partake of the fruits.
2 Timothy__02.7: Understand what I say: for the Lord will give thee in all things understanding.
2 Timothy__02.8: Be mindful that the Lord Jesus Christ is risen again from the dead, of the seed of David, according to my gospel.
2 Timothy__02.9: Wherein I labour even unto bands, as an evildoer; but the word of God is not bound.
2 Timothy__02.10: Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation, which is in Christ Jesus, with heavenly glory.
2 Timothy__02.11: A faithful saying: for if we be dead with him, we shall live also with him.
2 Timothy__02.12: If we suffer, we shall also reign with him. If we deny him, he will also deny us.
2 Timothy__02.13: If we believe not, he continueth faithful, he can not deny himself.
2 Timothy__02.14: Of these things put them in mind, charging them before the Lord. Contend not in words, for it is to no profit, but to the subverting of the hearers.
2 Timothy__02.15: Carefully study to present thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly handling the word of truth.
2 Timothy__02.16: But shun profane and vain babblings: for they grow much towards ungodliness.
2 Timothy__02.17: And their speech spreadeth like a canker: of whom are Hymeneus and Philetus:
2 Timothy__02.18: Who have erred from the truth, saying, that the resurrection is past already, and have subverted the faith of some.
2 Timothy__02.19: But the sure foundation of God standeth firm, having this seal: the Lord knoweth who are his; and let every one depart from iniquity who nameth the name of the Lord.
2 Timothy__02.20: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver, but also of wood and earth: and some indeed unto honour, but some unto dishonour.
2 Timothy__02.21: If any man therefore shall cleanse himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified and profitable to the Lord, prepared unto every good work.
2 Timothy__02.22: But flee thou youthful desires, and pursue justice, faith, charity, and peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
2 Timothy__02.23: And avoid foolish and unlearned questions, knowing that they beget strifes.
2 Timothy__02.24: But the servant of the Lord must not wrangle: but be mild towards all men, apt to teach, patient,
2 Timothy__02.25: With modesty admonishing them that resist the truth: if peradventure God may give them repentance to know the truth,
2 Timothy__02.26: And they may recover themselves from the snares of the devil, by whom they are held captive at his will.
